document.docTitle: Ocychinus smetanai Zhao & Tang 2020, sp. n.
document.masterDocTitle: Three new species of the genus Ocychinus (Coleoptera, Staphylinidae) from China

FIGURES 27–34.
Ocychinus smetanai .
27 male sternite IX; 28 male tergite X; 29, 30 aedeagus; 31–34 apical portion of paramere. Scale bars = 0.2 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Forebody with metallic purple tint, ventral side brownish; abdomen brownish with weak metallic purple tint except segment VIII, the genital segment and apical margin of segment VII which are yellowish; appendages reddish with coxae darker.

Head 1.06–1.09 times as wide as long, roundish, posterior angles entirely rounded, tempora longer than eyes (ratio 1.46–1.73), dorsal surface of head with dual punctation, fine punctures intermixed with markedly coarser punctures, the punctation of middle portion distinctly sparser than that of the lateral portions, interstices densely reticulated, interstices of lateral portions varied from narrower than half diameter of the coarse punctures to about as wide as coarse punctures.

Pronotum 1.20–1.27 times as long as wide, widest point a little before basal half, impunctate midline very indistinct; surface with dual punctation, though coarse punctures mainly present near anterior angles, punctures on lateral portions more or less confluent, interstices similar to that of head.
Elytra 0.84–0.95 times as long as wide, shorter than pronotum (ratio 0.73–0.82).
Abdomen semi-cylindrical, posterior margin of tergite VII without palisade fringe; tergites III–VII with punctation moderately sparse and moderately coarse, interstices transversely microsculptured.

Etymology. This species is named in honor of Dr. Aleš Smetana who established the genus
Ocychinus .
